body_html:
Usage:

usage: run_test.py [-h] [-v] [-p PYTHON] [-c] [-i TESTS [TESTS ...]]
                   [-x TESTS [TESTS ...]] [-f TESTS] [-l TESTS]
                   [--ignore-win-blacklist]

Run the PyTorch unit test suite

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --verbose         print verbose information and test-by-test results
  -p PYTHON, --python PYTHON
                        the python interpreter to execute tests with
  -c, --coverage        enable coverage
  -i TESTS [TESTS ...], --include TESTS [TESTS ...]
                        select a set of tests to include (defaults to ALL
                        tests)
  -x TESTS [TESTS ...], --exclude TESTS [TESTS ...]
                        select a set of tests to exclude
  -f TESTS, --first TESTS
                        select the test to start from (excludes previous
                        tests)
  -l TESTS, --last TESTS
                        select the last test to run (excludes following tests)
  --ignore-win-blacklist
                        always run blacklisted windows tests

where TESTS is any of: autograd, cpp_extensions, cuda, dataloader,
distributed, distributions, indexing, jit, legacy_nn, multiprocessing, nccl,
nn, optim, sparse, torch, utils

body:
Usage:
```
usage: run_test.py [-h] [-v] [-p PYTHON] [-c] [-i TESTS [TESTS ...]]
                   [-x TESTS [TESTS ...]] [-f TESTS] [-l TESTS]
                   [--ignore-win-blacklist]

Run the PyTorch unit test suite

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --verbose         print verbose information and test-by-test results
  -p PYTHON, --python PYTHON
                        the python interpreter to execute tests with
  -c, --coverage        enable coverage
  -i TESTS [TESTS ...], --include TESTS [TESTS ...]
                        select a set of tests to include (defaults to ALL
                        tests)
  -x TESTS [TESTS ...], --exclude TESTS [TESTS ...]
                        select a set of tests to exclude
  -f TESTS, --first TESTS
                        select the test to start from (excludes previous
                        tests)
  -l TESTS, --last TESTS
                        select the last test to run (excludes following tests)
  --ignore-win-blacklist
                        always run blacklisted windows tests

where TESTS is any of: autograd, cpp_extensions, cuda, dataloader,
distributed, distributions, indexing, jit, legacy_nn, multiprocessing, nccl,
nn, optim, sparse, torch, utils
```
